p: In the HPLC chromatogram obtained from anti-inflammatory extracts of P. perfoliatum, the researcher found that the peak of quercetin-3-O-β-D-glucuronide is the highest. Moreover, it was found that quercetin-3-O-β-D-glucuronide could inhibit lipid peroxidation ( Shirai et al., 2001; Begum and Terao, 2002), angiotensin II-stimulated JNK activation ( Kyaw et al., 2004), and the production of reactive oxygen species (ROS) ( Shirai et al., 2006). The content of quercetin-3-O-β-D-glucuronide was 0.90%, which was higher than that of quercetin in P. perfoliatum, indicating that the quercetin-3-O-β-D-glucuronide was one of the major active compounds of P. perfoliatum, and it is closely related to the anti-inflammatory effect.
